location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 37 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: The enclosure can be found on f 77, it has been separated from the main letter, which is located on ff 74v-75.

mods.abstract: The letter concerns a firmaun [firman] the Resident has received from Prince Hoosain Ali Meerza [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā], which requested assistance for Mahomed Hoosain Beg who is travelling to Calcutta. It explains that the Resident has used the opportunity to draw the Prince's attention to the neglect that he has shown to his office; the substance of this letter is enclosed, see f 77.
